DataElement.preferredName: Plasma Cell Myeloma Molecule Receptor Number Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of myeloma molecules sensitive to a receptor used to assess minimal residual disease by sequencing.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Receptor sensitive to myeloma molecules used to assess minimal residual disease by sequencing.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A bone marrow-based plasma cell neoplasm characterized by a serum monoclonal protein and skeletal destruction with osteolytic lesions, pathological fractures, bone pain, hypercalcemia, and anemia.  Clinical variants include non-secretory myeloma, smoldering myeloma, indolent myeloma, and plasma cell leukemia. (WHO, 2001)

Property.preferredDefinition: A protein located on the cell surface, or in the cytoplasm, that binds to a specific signaling factor, such as a hormone, antigen, or neurotransmitter, causing a conformational and functional change in the receptor molecule.  The ligand-bound receptor then alters its interaction with target molecules, which leads to changes in cellular physiology through modification of the activity of one or more signal transduction pathways.:An aggregate of two or more atoms in a defined arrangement held together by chemical bonds.

Concepts.definition: A protein located on the cell surface, or in the cytoplasm, that binds to a specific signaling factor, such as a hormone, antigen, or neurotransmitter, causing a conformational and functional change in the receptor molecule.  The ligand-bound receptor then alters its interaction with target molecules, which leads to changes in cellular physiology through modification of the activity of one or more signal transduction pathways.
An aggregate of two or more atoms in a defined arrangement held together by chemical bonds.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Value expressed as a number with 12 digits total, with 5 after the decimal.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Number of myeloma molecules d
ReferenceDocuments.description: Number of myeloma molecules detected by a receptor

DataElement.changeDescription: New CDE curated by L. Bradley (OHSU Knight)
